title: Gallo-Roman structures at Perron
description: Remains of a series of structures dating to the first 3 centuries of the common era -- including a probable villa -- were excavated in 1989 at a village called Perron in the French commune of Saint-Sauveur, on the north bank of the Is√®re river.

properties.description: Representative point determined through analysis of Google Earth imagery following Fig. 2 in De Klijn 1994. Dates after De Klijn.
properties.title: Imagery location for area of excavation
